LCD TVs have light leak - light leakage; on a totally black or white background, that's remarkable. In this device, at the ends you can notice this, plus a slight difference in the form of slightly darker/lighter vertical bars along the display. On backgrounds with images this is not so noticeable, even imperceptible. For those who go from a plasma to an lcd, this can be a nuisance, but a common problem with technology. Don't trust the images or description given by the Americans: the device is "fatter" (2x deeper than it appears from the images) despite the front design being the same. Also, on the day of purchase, the information in the description was that the refresh rate of the panel was 120Hz + refresh with 120Hz software. This was changed days later to the correct information: 60Hz/120Hz respectively. The quality of the images displayed is very good, vivid colors, and the sound of the tv is excellent, loud, without distortion. The webOS system is fluid and easy to connect the device to PC/smartphone. The tv's wifi is not compatible with 5GHz networks - even if it is able to connect to them, it is not able to reach speeds greater than 1.5Mb - use a 2.5GHz connection and the problem will disappear, allowing speeds of approximately 50Mb (even if your internet is faster than this). A better panel, no light leakage, and a more accurate description of the product (or the product itself presented in the description...) would have guaranteed a better evaluation.
